revised_title: Pleistocene Human Skeleton Discovery at Tilbury Fort, Essex
tldr: This article describes the discovery of a human skeleton from the Pleistocene (Palaeolithic) era in Tilbury, Essex. The skeleton was found during dock excavations at a depth of 32 feet and consists of a significant proportion of bones that are determined and described. The individual is inferred to be an aged male with great muscular strength. The author acknowledges the help of Colonel Du Plat Taylor and Mr. Donald Baynes for the transmission and section of the strata.
